svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - May 27 2023

title: "Week in Ethereum News
May 27, 2023" date: "2023-05-27"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
• Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes from Tim Beiko
and Christine Kim : SELFDESTRUCT removal impact analysis : EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in same tx) is
low impact and will be in Cancun; EIP6913 SETCODE not in Cancun for now EIP4844 discussions:
excess_data_gas, use big endian for precompile, remove SSZ EIPs, draft devnet 6 spec (last EIP4844
specific devnet before Dencun devnets) Proposed ordering of Cancun & Prague opcodes being added to
execution specs Final candidates for inclusion in Cancun: EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM), EIP2537
(BLS precompile), EIP5656 (MCOPY), EIP5920 (PAY) & EIP7069 (revamped CALL instructions); no more EIPs
to be considered for Cancun
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko . Notes from Tim Beiko and
Christine Kim :
• SELFDESTRUCT removal impact analysis : EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in same tx) is low impact and will
be in Cancun; EIP6913 SETCODE not in Cancun for now
SELFDESTRUCT removal impact analysis : EIP6780 (SELFDESTRUCT only in same tx) is low impact and will
• EIP4844 discussions: excess_data_gas, use big endian for precompile, remove SSZ EIPs, draft devnet 6
spec (last EIP4844 specific devnet before Dencun devnets)
EIP4844 discussions: excess_data_gas, use big endian for precompile, remove SSZ EIPs, draft devnet 6
• Proposed ordering of Cancun & Prague opcodes being added to execution specs
Proposed ordering of Cancun & Prague opcodes being added to execution specs
• Final candidates for inclusion in Cancun: EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM), EIP2537 (BLS
precompile), EIP5656 (MCOPY), EIP5920 (PAY) & EIP7069 (revamped CALL instructions); no more EIPs to be
considered for Cancun
Final candidates for inclusion in Cancun: EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM), EIP2537 (BLS
• Consensus-specs v1.4.0-alpha.0 : Deneb updates & attnets revamp
Consensus-specs v1.4.0-alpha.0 : Deneb updates & attnets revamp
• KZG ceremony nears 100k contributions, now available to accounts with 16 mainnet transactions
KZG ceremony nears 100k contributions, now available to accounts with 16 mainnet transactions
Layer 1
• Ben Edgington: deposits & withdrawals , new chapter from Upgrading Ethereum book
Ben Edgington: deposits & withdrawals , new chapter from Upgrading Ethereum book
• Geth team: what happens if a supermajority EL client has a bug ?
Geth team: what happens if a supermajority EL client has a bug ?
• Verkle overlay tree conversion method implemented
Verkle overlay tree conversion method implemented
Client releases
• Consensus layer: Lighthouse v4.2.0 : validator client faster to detect & avoid beacon nodes with
offline execution layer Prysm v4.0.5 : attestation aggregation improvements
Consensus layer:
• Lighthouse v4.2.0 : validator client faster to detect & avoid beacon nodes with offline execution
layer
Lighthouse v4.2.0 : validator client faster to detect & avoid beacon nodes with offline execution
• Prysm v4.0.5 : attestation aggregation improvements
Prysm v4.0.5 : attestation aggregation improvements
• Execution layer: Geth v1.12.0 : PoW removed, GraphQL numeric values encoded as hex strings
Nethermind v1.18.2 : sync process accelerated
Execution layer:
• Geth v1.12.0 : PoW removed, GraphQL numeric values encoded as hex strings
Geth v1.12.0 : PoW removed, GraphQL numeric values encoded as hex strings
• Nethermind v1.18.2 : sync process accelerated
For Stakers
• Eth-wizard v0.9.7 : validator setup on Ubuntu/Windows with MEV-Boost
Research
• Path to enshrined Proposer-Builder Separation : top-down via Two-Block HeadLock (variant of two-slot
PBS) and bottom-up via optimistic relay
Path to enshrined Proposer-Builder Separation : top-down via Two-Block HeadLock (variant of two-slot
• Timing games : proposer may delay block proposal to maximize MEV but still be early enough to be
included
Timing games : proposer may delay block proposal to maximize MEV but still be early enough to be
Layer 2
• Distributed Sequencer Technology : proposal for progressive decentralization of L2 sequencers using
Distributed Validator Technology
Distributed Sequencer Technology : proposal for progressive decentralization of L2 sequencers using
• Layer N zk fraud proofs : hybrid approach only requires a proof to be generated when there is
possibility of fraud
Layer N zk fraud proofs : hybrid approach only requires a proof to be generated when there is
EIPs/Standards
• EIPs: EIP7069 : Revamped CALL instructions
EIPs:
• EIP7069 : Revamped CALL instructions
• ERCs: ERC7050 : NFT creator provenance ERC7053 : Interoperable digital media indexing ERC7066 :
ERC721 lockable
ERCs:
• ERC7050 : NFT creator provenance
ERC7050 : NFT creator provenance
• ERC7053 : Interoperable digital media indexing
ERC7053 : Interoperable digital media indexing
• ERC7066 : ERC721 lockable
ERC7066 : ERC721 lockable
Stuff for developers
• OpenZeppelin Contracts v4.9.0 : Governor with Timestamps support for Optimism & Base, ERC4626
inflation attack protection, default admin rules for AccessControl, improved EIP712 signature
interoperability via EIP-5267 and ERC777 deprecated
OpenZeppelin Contracts v4.9.0 : Governor with Timestamps support for Optimism & Base, ERC4626
• Solc contract metadata explainer: IPFS hash of JSON metadata + Solidity version
Solc contract metadata explainer: IPFS hash of JSON metadata + Solidity version
• Foundry: Foundry pre v1 update highlights Forge-std v1.5.6 : new cheatcodes and pure console log
tip: console logging supports format specifiers e.g. %s and %d
Foundry:
• Foundry pre v1 update highlights
Foundry pre v1 update highlights
• Forge-std v1.5.6 : new cheatcodes and pure console log
Forge-std v1.5.6 : new cheatcodes and pure console log
• tip: console logging supports format specifiers e.g. %s and %d
• abi-to-sol v0.7 : generate embeddable output (e.g. no pragma, no license identifier)
abi-to-sol v0.7 : generate embeddable output (e.g. no pragma, no license identifier)
• Guide to finding precision loss vulnerabilities using fuzz testing
Guide to finding precision loss vulnerabilities using fuzz testing
• Cicada : private on-chain voting using homomorphic time-lock puzzles
Cicada : private on-chain voting using homomorphic time-lock puzzles
• Vyper v0.3.8 : transient storage keyword, ternary operators, raw_revert builtin, shift operators,
configurable send() gas stipend and use PUSH0
Vyper v0.3.8 : transient storage keyword, ternary operators, raw_revert builtin, shift operators,
• Ape v0.6.9 : easier testing via Pytest fixtures, Python v3.11 support and use_network marker
Ape v0.6.9 : easier testing via Pytest fixtures, Python v3.11 support and use_network marker
• Uniswap live on Sepolia testnet
Uniswap live on Sepolia testnet
• enstate.rs : simultaneous ENS queries with caching, in Rust
enstate.rs : simultaneous ENS queries with caching, in Rust
• Safer : sign & submit transactions to a Safe multisig using Foundry scripts
Safer : sign & submit transactions to a Safe multisig using Foundry scripts
• Curta CTF Baby it’s me solution
Curta CTF Baby it’s me solution
• Code specification overview : focus on plain english, state machines, diagramming, interfaces,
placeholder tests and optionally formal definitions
Code specification overview : focus on plain english, state machines, diagramming, interfaces,
• Echidna v2.2.0 : multicore fuzzing & optimized coverage collection, up to 20x faster fuzzing
Echidna v2.2.0 : multicore fuzzing & optimized coverage collection, up to 20x faster fuzzing
Security
• Tornado Cash governance captured by attacker using SELFDESTRUCT + CREATE2
Ecosystem
• Vitalik: overloading Ethereum’s social consensus is high-risk , app devs & Layer 2s need to find
alternatives to achieve their security goals, there will be no bailouts
Vitalik: overloading Ethereum’s social consensus is high-risk , app devs & Layer 2s need to find
• Nick Fett: restaking is overhyped
Nick Fett: restaking is overhyped

• Astaria (NFT-backed lending) live on mainnet, beta

• Safe multisig adds ERC1271 message signing support (used for OpenSea signing)

• Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate

Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable to abcoathup.eth. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
• US Fed : 10% of adults used crypto in 2022
US Fed : 10% of adults used crypto in 2022
• Dan Elitzer: DeFi primitives should have no governance, no upgradeability and no oracles

General/crypto
• Taylor warns of targeted spearphishing

• KeePass vulnerability , master password can be retrieved from memory

@evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
